titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Greenleaf Whittier Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 05:14

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers: Za Whittier, Uncat Za File 449-450, Uncat Za File 491, Uncat Za File 650-653

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Abel Cary Thomas Gift, 1832-1934. II. Owen Franklin Aldis Gift, 1844-1888. III. Material from Other Sources, 1831-1942.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Greenleaf Whittier Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The John Greenleaf Whittier Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

bioghist.head: John Greenleaf Whittier (1807-1892)
bioghist.p: John Greenleaf Whittier, American poet and abolitionist. Known as America's "Quaker poet," Whittier was a prolific writer who produced more than forty volumes of poetry and prose during his lifetime. Summary information is available in the standard print and online biographical resources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John Greenleaf Whittier collection contains correspondence, writings, and other papers by or relating to the nineteenth-century American poet and abolitionist John Greenleaf Whittier. Correspondence consists entirely of autograph letters, signed or initialed. Writings include autograph manuscript drafts or copies of poems and proofs, many also signed or initialed. Other papers include artistic and photographic portraits of Whittier.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired primarily through gift from Abel Cary Thomas and Owen Franklin Aldis. For more information, consult the appropriate curator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Abel Cary Thomas Gift, consists of letters and drafts of poems by Whittier housed in two volumes. Volume 1 contains autograph letters, signed or initialed, arranged alphabetically by name of recipient. Volume 2 is subdivided for autograph manuscript writings, also signed or initialed, and autograph letters, signed.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Abel Cary Thomas, date unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes draft, autograph, of poem "To Garibaldi"

did.unittitle: "Bayard Taylor," third stanza, autograph manuscript, signed
"The Brown Dwarf of Rugen," autograph manuscript, corrected
["I pray the prayer of Plato old..."], autograph manuscript, signed
"My Triumph," stanzas VIII-IX, autograph manuscript, corrected and signed
["Not vainly in the persian clime..."], autograph manuscript, signed
["Our lines are albums. As we turn..."], autograph manuscript, signed
"Seed-time and Harvest," third stanza, autograph manuscript, signed
["To the brave, the elements..."], autograph manuscript, signed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Owen Franklin Aldis Gift, consists of letters and writings by Whittier. The series is subdivided for autograph letters, signed, and writings, which include drafts of poems, autograph manuscript, signed or initialed, and a page proof for the Introduction to Edwin Percy Whipple's American Literature (Boston: Ticknor and Company, 1887), with annotations in Whittier's hand.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Correspondence and Writings.

did.unittitle: ["Faith shares the future's promise: love's..."], autograph manuscript, signed
"Introduction" to Edwin Percy Whipple's American Literature (Boston: Ticknor and Company, 1887), page proofs, with corrections and annotations in Whittier's hand
["Keep who will the city's alleys..."], autograph manuscript, initialed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poem on verso of ALS, dated 24 December 1859, from William [Cullen] Bryant

did.unittitle: ["Shew thy vacant tomb..."], autograph manuscript, signed

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired from various sources. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Correspondence, Writings, and Other Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, Material from Other Sources, includes correspondence from Whittier, writings by Whittier, and other papers. There are additional autograph letters, signed, and autograph manuscript drafts and proofs of writings, some also signed, as well as artisitic and photographic portraits of Whittier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes third party letters from Martha Hale Shackford to John A. Pollard, dated 1949, and from John A. Pollard to Donald Gallup, dated 1963

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains typescript copy of letter and clippings dating from 1944

"The Cry of a Lost Soul," Portugese translation, "O choro d'uma alma perdida" by Dom Pedro, autograph manuscript (photostat)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence about the poem and translation
